EEG Visualization

Real-time EEG data visualization tool for brain-computer interface research

January 26, 2025

A comprehensive tool for visualizing EEG (Electroencephalogram) data in real-time, designed to assist researchers and practitioners in brain-computer interface development and neuroscience research.

Overview

This project provides an intuitive interface for visualizing EEG signals, enabling researchers to observe brain activity patterns in real-time. The tool supports multiple visualization modes and can process data from various EEG devices.

Key Features

  • Real-time Data Processing: Visualize EEG signals as they are recorded
  • Multiple Visualization Modes: Time series, frequency analysis, and topographical maps
  • Signal Filtering: Built-in filters for noise reduction and signal enhancement
  • Export Capabilities: Save visualizations and processed data for further analysis
  • Device Compatibility: Works with popular EEG hardware

Technologies Used

  • Python: Core programming language
  • NumPy & SciPy: Signal processing and mathematical computations
  • Matplotlib: Data visualization and plotting
  • PyQt/Tkinter: User interface development
  • MNE-Python: EEG data handling and processing

Applications

This tool is particularly useful for:

  • Brain-computer interface research
  • Neurofeedback applications
  • Educational purposes in neuroscience
  • Clinical EEG monitoring
  • Real-time brain state analysis
